caption: The food is amazing here and I highly recommend you try them out when you want something good to eat. And the service is one of a kind.
The food is amazing here and I do recommend and try this place out. They have an amazing menu and the staff are very friendly too.
The food is amazing here, everything on their menu taste amazing! And they have an excellent menu selection here too.
Feels like a home away from home. 🏡

Completely excited to find a southern food spot that is so welcoming and the food is delicious! The owner was soooooo understanding of my allergies and made the food with understanding. He was honest on him trying to keep his business open on his own throughout these harsh times serving and cooking in his own so a bit of a wait but completely worth it! The music and space outside is so calming and relaxing for a night out in a soul food mood. Thank you again!
Good food, good atmosphere.
Give us back our deposit.
We gave a cash deposit to book a space, due to the virus we had to cancel the event and we never saw our money back ! SHAME !

username: สมคิด คิด

caption: Give back the deposit
We booked for a dinner but the restaurant was closed due to covid and they kept the deposit. I hope you will find a way to give the deposit back.
(Translated by Google) Give back the money  (Original) Gief back the money
Very disappointed by the dishonest behavior of the owner who refused to give us back our 560$ deposit while they couldn’t honor the service we booked!!!
Reeeeend l'argent.  Stole 500$ deposit during lockdown
Waiting for our deposit back...
Changed my commentary to 1 star for now since the owner don’t want to refund our deposit of 560$...  Best East Harlem restaurant ! The owner and the place is amazing !

One of the nicest experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. It was so beautiful inside. From the music, the decor and the personal service. The food is made on the spot and you need a reservation but trust me, it's so worth it
Owner/chef very personable. Great food.

Best soul food I have had in New York. Shrimp & Grits, Mac & Cheese. It’s all good and it’s BYOB! The service is excellent the and music, whether from the owner’s personal selection or live artists, fits the ambiance perfectly.
Hog mores & Chitterlings- Some people love them!!!
Visited SpaHA Soul for my birthday dinner and I have to say the cozy ambiance and delicious home cooked meal was everything I needed! THE BEST dining experience I've had in a long time! BYOB :)
Sorry, but it was not fresh, tasty, or seasoned. It was microwaved and old. No soda, juice, nothing. Just hot water with no ice.
Food food food😋

If you want an incredible meal with impeccable service, this is the spot. Artist is the owner/chef/server and does it all magically. Bring a bottle of wine and someone you like spending time with and be prepared for one of the best meals of your life.
The restaurant looked really nice; loved the decor and music. The food is nothing short of spectacular and Artist was super nice and welcoming. Loved everything and will be sure to go back!
One of best food experiences I have had. The owner and chef is very accommodating and friendly, and home cooks per table. He also makes great conversation. BYOB also.

Having dinner at SpaHa Soul is like coming home to a meal cooked with love! The cuisine is masterfully prepared by Chef Artist Thornton who takes his time to season, bake, or fry every dish to perfection. I love his twist on the classic fried chicken and collared greens, but brunch is equally scrumptious. Of course, the décor and  personality of the restaurant leave you wanting to stay well into the evening with revelry and laughs. I can't wait to eat here again. :)
(Translated by Google) Incredible place, amazing food!  (Original) Lugar incrível, comida incrível!

This was one of the greatest restaurant experiences I have ever had.  Artist and Kevin made us feel at home from the minute we walked in the door.  The setting is very relaxed and intimate- you feel welcome at home. The food is familiar, yet original, but all exceptional and unpretentious.  Everything is made with love and it shines through in every bite.
We were a party of 5 who arrived without a reservation. Owner could not have been nicer in accommodating us. The guy is a prince. Food was delicious too.
Best soul food I’ve had in years! Menu & prices are out of this world 👍😋
I don’t know what was better, our entreés or the music!  The owner is simply delightful and what a priviledge to be in the presence of his vision!

This place is amazing. Small and intimate setting. Everything is cooked fresh made to order. The waiter is very welcoming. Would recommend for a first time date or business dinner. Looking foward to eating here again.
Amazing place. This place is home.
Always wonderful,  nice ambiance, great family feeling.

The spaha rice, curried yams, macaroni and cheese and roasted pork chops was so delicious. Seasoned to perfection. Food made fresh while we waited. Live music was also great and musician took requests. Loved the ambiance and the owner/chef was very attentive. Will definitely go back to eat here again and bring friends.  Be sure to try the prixe meal where you get dessert- red velvet cake was so moisturized and delicious. The pumpkin soup was so smooth and delicious.
The food was very good The chef and the service was excellent. We will definitely visit again
The food is incredible and the service is very personal.

Was very interested following the NYT review. This restaurant apparently takes reservations only, but I managed to get in without one.  For a 15-25 seat restaurant, they only had 2 staff. The service was friendly, but it ends there. The food service was slow, and for such a restaurant, the execution was not great. It felt like the chef was very distracted, as he was managing the front and the back of the house. The other server was also frequently going out to buy stuff for the kitchen.  For drinks, they have a BYOB concept. That really means go get your drinks from the deli next door because we ain't serving any.  The food was also not great. Had fried chicken with Mac and cheese. The chicken came well brined and was juicy, but the chicken was very soft on the crust. You could taste the flavor in the batter, but the execution was not there. Not impressed especially when I'm going to consume that many calories.
It was closed that SUCKS

May be cozy, like family and lgbt friendly blah blah blah BUT even if you are polite, appropriate, quiet, a good tipper and presentable, DO NOT GO HERE if you dont want to be Stigmatized for having mentioned a depressive disorder to the owner in an attempt to establish a sense of safety. This will NOT be A WISE move. He will make you feel like garbage from then on
Best ever

I love this place! The food is delicious but the chef makes you feel special. It’s an amazing experience that everyone should have. My fave is the Mac and cheese and pork chops...like my mom used to make but with a heavenly twist.
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Excelente

Event was to start at 7:45 but plates didn’t come out until after 11. The chef emphasized how “they close at 11” though. Most of the party of 30 didn’t get served their plates until around 11:30. The food looked great but it was the worst soul food experience I’ve ever had. The rice was cold wet unseasoned and crunchy and the chicken was UNDERDONE. One guest was sick after a few bites of the BBQ chicken.  Few people sent their plates back and MAJORITY people didn’t even touch their food.  Salmon cakes were the only good thing.

I went there last night to celebrate with my lil cousin. The took so long with the food. They said it close at 11pm but brought the food out extremely late close to 11pm. They kept saying we close at 11pm but no food. When they brought the food out, it looked good til I taste it. It was horrible. Never in my life have I taste rice that was completely hard. The bbq chicken wasn't even cooked all the way. I like my food well done. When I said something The cooker looked confused. I waited one hour for another plate.  The macaroni and cheese was bad. They put too much garlic in it, all I taste was garlic. They rushed when they cooked because not one thing on my plate was cooked all the way. Wonder who cooked the food because this place had it bad last night serving 25 to 30 people. They only thing I enjoyed was the salmon cakes that's why I gave one star.

When we walked in, we knew we were in the presence of culinary magic.  The turkey, salmon, greens, and deserts were prepared beyond perfection, presented well, and needed no added seasoning.  The owner and chef, Artist Thornton, is to food what miracles are to living – rare and highly appreciated.   The atmosphere, understated elegance, is warm and relaxing. While it is a BYOB, Spaha Soul can have your wine and spirits delivered when you arrive, or you can always bring your own.  Moreover, the prices are budget-friendly! Spaha Soul is a culinary mind, soul, and palette experience and well worth a top entry on your A-list of places to go in the City. Around the corner from the 125th street, drop in at 2294 Second Avenue and prepare to be pampered and awed.

My family and I ate here on Thanksgiving.. and we loved it! It's cozy and welcoming. The food was excellent. Even my great nephew (age 6 ) was commenting on how great the food was. He was dancing while he ate, that says it all. The food was made with love. We loved everything about this place. And the decor was cute too.  F.Y.I It's B.Y.O.B .. which is perfect ... you can bring your own choice of beverage and not have to pay those ridiculously over priced alcoholic beverages like at other locations.  Thank you Artist for accommodating us
The entire menu is amazing and the service is even better

If you want an intimate dining experience and delicious food made with love, SpaHa Soul is for you. I had the baked chicken with gravy, collard greens and dirty rice for my meal and had to restrain myself from licking the plate!  The chicken was tender and moist and bathed in a creamy, rich and savory gravy. The greens had a nice spicy kick, while the dirty rice (wild grain with chicken gizzards) were nice and fluffy. Best of all, all the food is made to order for the freshest flavor. Note: this establishment is BYOB, so make sure to check out one of the local liquor stores if you plan on imbibing.
The food was absolutely amazing and so was the service! My new favorite spot in New York!!!
Very low-key chill spot .

The place is so.good i just had dinner there with my girlfriend and the food is freshly cooked the cook/owner is amazing at what he does he is truly an artist in the kitchen his staff very kind always checking to make sure you enjoy  and are satisfied with your meal and me and my girlfriend will def eat there again im.also planning on taking my mother there to try some official home cooking i wanted to tell the cook /owner myself how much i enjoyed my food but it got a little busy so he had to cook alot but i will defently go again with out a doubt i really enjoyed the hospitality

My boyfriend and I LOVE this restaurant and always felt so welcome walking in! I have some diet restrictions and the owner/chef was so understanding and made us an amazing meals. Definitely one of a kind place with terrific food. Recommend making a reservation or calling before as menu items sell out quickly. Catfish was unbelievable and I don't like it at all normally! Cornbread pancakes so so good too!
Great local place. Fresh and delicious food. Great atmosphere. Perfect place to bring a bottle of wine and to take your time enjoying an exquisite meal.
Great food and the chef is one of the coolest nicest guys you'll ever meet.  Small place but you should definitely try it.  You won't be disappointed.

Firstly this is a lovely addition to a changing neighborhood; it's one of those places that brings back memories of "old New York"; a small place with charm, great food, which I would call "elevated soul" with the traditional dishes, fried chicken, pork chops, mac & cheese etc. and where the owner takes the time to knows your name.  Artist (Chef & Owner) has specials that change often, which makes being a regular interesting as you never know what new things you might be trying to go along with your fried chicken (made to order).  I highly recommend the Prix Fix as you get the opportunity to try not only the traditional dishes, but will get to try the items on special. Did I mention Brunch, on Sat & Sun which includes Red Velvet pancakes!  I hope SpaHa will become that "neighborhood place" where you can take a date or your family; and still have a great time; especially if Artist has time to come out and say hello.

Great food great atmosphere amazingly nice owner. I wrote my first review October 2013 and have gone to this place more times than I can count.  I have been here at least 100 times.  Spaha Soul brings a great little restaurant to Pleasant Ave and East Harlem neighborhood. Owned by Artist T, he greets you with a hearty hello as you look around at the art (that rotates) and listen to the amazing music (often live) that creates a wonderful atmosphere.  Things you must know: 1) The food is fresh-orders daily and isn't made until you order it. 2) There is a huge variety on the menu for all food types:  'regular/traditional', vegetarian, pescatarian, vegan, paleo, etc. 3) Sunday is brunch/limited menu only 4) RSVPs never hurt because the restaurant is small 5) BYOB BUT BUT if you want to drink based on what you order, there is a great place that delivers (and around the corner).  Artist hands you his phone with the number programmed in to place your personal wine order. 6)  Delivery is not guaranteed-choose pick-up or dine in 7) Not sure what you want to eat?  Talk it out with him! 8)  Can you say deal?  Ask what the nightly pre fixe is.  You will get 3-4 scrumptious courses for $35; yes that is not a typo! 9) cash only  The owner and proprietor, Artist, makes the food from the heart.  Definitely a gem for the area!
Great food, Artist the owner, chef, DJ, waitstaff is the nicest guy. Make sure to give him a heads up by calling in advance on weeknights. Can not rate it highly enough! So good
It's only 4:30 and they're out of FOOD?!  Dear Management, your establishment serves food, perhaps you should develop a plan to ensure you have some.
Good soul food hands down!!!!! great chef!!!!! Atmosphere great! decor love it!!!! Food is fit for comfort!!!!
Much easier than going to New Orleans :-)
